sections.title: Welcome to the Guide
sections.content:
Thank you for buying!

Thanks for buying the LotusLabs NowPlaying widget!

If you have any problems or need any support, send a message in #np-support

This widget is an interactive guide that will not show on OBS! Click on this widget once, then on the left click 'Settings' and then use the the Previous/Next buttons to navigate between sections.

sections.title: OBS Setup
sections.content:
OBS Setup

  1. On StreamElements, click Save, then Preview and copy that link
  2. Go to OBS, create a Browser Source and paste that link
  3. Set the height to 116 and width to 1080
  4. Make sure that 'Shutdown source when not visible' and 'Refresh browser when scene becomes active' are both off

Important: Make sure not to have multiple different versions of the overlay active at once as this can cause problems, such as reactions.

sections.title: Last.fm
sections.content:
Last.fm

This assumes that you already have a Last.fm account and have linked it to the streaming service that you use.

  1. Head over to https://www.last.fm/api/account/create
  2. Fill in the form:
    • Contact email: your email
    • Application name: np widget (you can put anything)
    • You don't have to put anything in the other fields
  3. Click Submit
  4. Note down the API key
  5. In the widget config, put the API key in the "Last.FM API Key" field
  6. Put your Last.fm username in the "Last.FM Account Username" field

sections.title: Container Customisations
sections.content:
Container Customisations

Spawn Side

Choose which side of the screen the widget appears from: Left, Center, or Right.

Maximum Width

Set the maximum width of the widget container. Must be greater than 260 (e.g., 520).

Container Glow

Enable a glow effect around the container.

Gradient Background

Enable a gradient background that dynamically changes based on the album cover colors.

Disable Background

Remove the background entirely, making the widget transparent.

sections.title: Cover Image
sections.content:
Cover Image

Loading Image URL

Set a custom loading animation/image URL. Supports webm, gif, mp4, and avif formats.

Loading Image Format

Select the format of your loading image: webm, gif, mp4, or avif.

Fallback Album Image URL

Set an image URL that displays when the album cover fails to load.

sections.title: Compact Mode
sections.content:
Compact Mode

Compact mode shows a smaller version of the widget, useful when gaming.

Command to Change Game

Set the chat command that changes the current game (default: !setgame).

Command to Toggle Compact Mode

Set the chat command that manually toggles compact mode (default: !compacttoggle).

Compact Mode Toggle

  • Always: Widget is always in compact mode
  • Never: Widget never uses compact mode
  • When Gaming: Automatically switches to compact mode when not in "Just chatting"
  • Hidden When Gaming: Widget hides completely when gaming

Default Game

Set your default game category (default: "Just chatting").

sections.title: Chat Reactions
sections.content:
Chat Reactions

Allow viewers to react to the current song using channel point redemptions.

Enable Chat Reactions

Turn on the chat reaction feature.

Redemption Name

Set the name of the channel point redemption (default: "React to the song").

Reset Reactions After Each Song

Clear all reactions when a new song starts playing.

Allow Duplicate Reactions from Users

Allow the same user to react multiple times to the same song.

sections.title: Text
sections.content:
Text

Default Font

Use the default widget font (Metropolis) or choose a custom Google Font.

Use Google Font

If "Default font" is set to "No", you can select a custom Google Font to use.

sections.title: Colours
sections.content:
Colours

Song Name Colours

Set separate colors for light and dark album covers for the song name text.

Artist Name Colours

Set separate colors for light and dark album covers for the artist name text.

Fade In Highlight

Enable dynamic fade-in highlight that changes color based on the album cover. You can also set a custom color.

Reaction Colours

Set colors for reaction image backgrounds and reaction counter text. Enable dynamic colors to automatically adjust based on album cover, or use static light/dark colors.

Progress Bar Colours

Set colors for the progress bar fill and background for both light and dark album covers.

sections.title: Progress Bar
sections.content:
Progress Bar

Display a progress bar showing how far through the current song you are.

Enable Progress Bar

Turn on the progress bar feature.

Enable Progress Bar in Compact Mode

Show the progress bar even when the widget is in compact mode.

sections.title: Love
sections.content:
Love

Display a heart icon when you love a track on Last.fm.

Enable Love

Turn on the love feature.

Heart Colour

Set the color of the heart icon.

Enable Heart Border Always

Always show a border around the heart icon, even when not loved.

sections.title: Birthday Mode
sections.content:
Birthday Mode (Confetti)

Celebrate special occasions with confetti effects!

Toggle Confetti

Enable confetti effects for your birthday.

Amount of Confetti

Set how many confetti particles appear (default: 50).

Confetti Colors

Set custom colors for the confetti. Use comma-separated hex colors (e.g., #FF9AA2,#FFB7A2,#FFDAC1).

Birthday Day & Month

Set your birthday date. The confetti will automatically trigger on that day.
